The claim was fact: checked using the 2017 Land Audit Report published by the Department for Rural Development and Land Reform.
The report categorized land ownership in: companies, community-based organizations, trusts, and co-owned land.
The report specifically highlighted that: there were greater concentrations of ownership by white South Africans compared to the meme's claim, despite white South Africans making up only 7.8 percent of the population.
